column4: Hello, I've just bought a new computer which has Ubuntu, and I want to double-boot XP with it, but I don't know how to use the GNU Parted
the first step is for you to burn an ubuntu desktop cd so you can repartition
I take that back, the very first step is to back up your files
such things exist, yes. but that is not as easy as backing up, burning an ubuntu cd
Is there how to burn the entire Ubuntu system (2gb apparently) on a DVD, format, instal XP, repartition and then install Ubuntu?
yes, but those are separate howtos. again, I wouldn't try making a DVD from your system. it's harder
windows doesn't have as many games as playstation. maybe that's what you need
on top of that, you can still run ubuntu on playstation
sudo fdisk -l /dev/sda  will tell you if it's swap
Should I delete the 233gb partition, make a new 213 one for windows, leaving 20gb for Linux?
you also need a swap partition, and possibly anything else you want on a partition
